ref: 14160 hētú m. ʻ motive, cause, reason ʼ Mn. [√hi]

lang: Aśokan, i.e. the language of the Inscriptions of Aśoka
ref: Aś. hetuto, ˚ute ʻ by reason of ʼ,

lang: Language of `Kharoṣṭhī Inscriptions discovered by Sir Aurel Stein in Chinese Turkestan' edited by A. M. Boyer, E. J. Rapson, and E. Senart

ref: Si. heya ʻ reason ʼ, heyin ʻ on account of ʼ.
